content.raw:
Actually, that last example is wrong, due to shutter delays. Perhaps the close_from (or possible another new command, e.g. close_after(t) )  command should make the shutter start closing at the earliest possible time after the time specified? This then leads to a higher likelihood of commands getting tangled and overwriting each other, but as long as there are warnings when this happens it should be ok.
This then allows the user to program in short shutter times without having to worry about the restrictions.
